turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I am so sorry about your men.

turns.speaker: RUSS
turns.text: Yes sir, me too. The State Department has authorized release of the funds. We'll have to make the first drop at 7.  As soon as they pick up the money, we've got ÂŒem.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: And Mr. Lee?  Where is he?

turns.speaker: RUSS
turns.text: Don't worry, he's with Carter.

turns.speaker: SOON YOUNG
turns.text: When were you going to tell me you were not going with us?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I still have work to do here.

turns.speaker: SOON YOUNG
turns.text: I don't believe you.  My father was explaining to Mr. Griffin.  That is how I found out.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I was trying to find the right time.

turns.speaker: SOON YOUNG
turns.text: After I left?

turns.speaker: SOON YOUNG
turns.text: I will not have friends in America.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Soon Young, don't worry.  You will have many friends very soon.  You will see.  America is a very friendly place.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: What is he up to now?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Ike just came by to check out the team.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Bob -- are you making friends with this man?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'm just bragging about how great you are.  I'm the luckiest man alive.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: At the wedding?  You invite him?  Bob, don't you realize he's writing another article about me?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Sure I do.  But the bet defense is a good offense, right?  You're not going to let your opponent throw you off your game.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You don't understand this guy.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Let him come to the wedding.  You're not running, right?  Say it. "I'm not..."

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: I'm not running.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: So if you're not running and Ike Graham is there to see it, then any article he writes has got to have a happy ending, right?  All we're doing is turning lemon into lemonade.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: I've got news for you.  No amount of sugar and water is going to turn like Graham into something you want to take on a picnic.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I lead Maggie through a visualization exercise.  All the sports shrinks use this head stuff.  Visualize the end zone, if you catch my drift.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Let me take you back inside, okay?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Ahh.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'm the town's unofficial fitness trainer.  Big advocate of the mind and body combining for success.  You could say or you can quote me, I'm a glass half full king of guy.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: See you at the wedding.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: You bet ya, Coach.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: At this pace, it could be an evening wedding.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Hold it!  Hold it!  I think we're taking this too fast.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: What do you expect me to say to this?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: How about -- "I hope you'll be very happy together"?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You look awful.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I didn't want to find out I wasn't for her in the fourth quarter.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Got any last minute advice?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Maintain eye contact.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Actually, he only asked me one ridiculous question.  The rest weren't so bad.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: What?  You talked to him!  Did you tell him we dated before you were a priest?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Yes, yes, I'm sure I only did you good, Maggie.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: What did he ask?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Only respectful things.  What did we have in common back then... What kind of music did you like... Did you ruin my life when you left me standing at the altar...

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: And what did you say?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: How could I be angry at you when clearly what has happened to me is as God intended?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Good one!  Thanks.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: It happens to be how I feel.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: God... Of course.  I'm sorry -- I mean, I'm...  Brian -- I've got to go.  The man's a lunatic, but I know exactly where he's going next.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: God bless you, Maggie.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: He wanted to know how you used to like your eggs.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Weird.  Like after all those years you would remem--

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: I'm really sorry that I hurt you, Brian.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I'm happy here, where I'm supposed to be.  But if you ever become a Catholic, may I ask you a favor, Maggie?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Could your confess to Father Patrick from now on?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: That's it.  Back to obedience school.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Okay -- have a seat... gently, carefully.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: And in a "V".

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Eight is good... "V" could be Victory.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: We do it to our dog.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: It's hurting.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: We'll rub.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I'll get the dress.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: He's here!... He's here!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Tell me, why does Maggie need another wedding rehearsal and two days before the wedding?  She's already done this.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: Bob is making her visualize the ceremony.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Bob's in a hurry.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: Don't be nervous, Maggie.  Let us visualize.  Remember what Bob said? "Be the ball."

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: "Sink the putt."

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: "Make the shot."

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: "Nothing but net."

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: "Never say die."

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I love his eyes.  I just believe they're listening to you.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: His hair... any color.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Rub your ears.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: Yes, rubbing your ears is very soothing. Cory does that to me when I hyperventilate.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Fully.  I like her.  She has wit.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I left four messages.  You don't return my calls.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: So?  I never returned your calls, even when we were married.  And what's Fisher doing here anyway?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: -- It's for you, Ike.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Journalism lesson number one.  If you fabricate your facts, you get fired.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Lesson number two.  Never work for your former spouse.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: That's not nothing to do with it.  You cooked this story up and you know it.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I didn't cook up a story.  I had a source.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Someone reliable, I'm sure.  A booze- hound in a bar?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: No, that's what makes you unemployed.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I merely write the stuff.  You're the one that serves it up.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Lawyers.  I don't know, Ellie -- Firing me is going to be very tough on you.  It's going to be hard to get over.  There will be therapy bills for you.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I already made an appointment for later today.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: See?  You want custody of my job? ... Why not just consider my wrist slapped and call me when you feel I've served my time?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I'm sorry, Ike.  This is permanent.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Fisher, let him talk.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: But one of those guys -- not one of them -- knew her at all.  Each one was convinced that she was perfect for them, but they didn't see her.  And she never showed up so they couldn't see her. It's a very symbolic thing happening. She becomes what she thinks they wanted to be.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Is that what I did to you?  Is that what happened?  Did I just not see you?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: No.  No, you didn't.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Well -- I'm sorry, I'm really sorry, Ellie.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I'm sorry, too.  Wow.  That only took us between years to say.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Maggie!

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Where do you think she's going?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Overpriced nice apartment and Chinese takeout.  That's New York living.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: ... Just call me when you have it.  Ike, how is the story coming?  Is she a man-eater?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Or a vegetarian?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Or does she pick "NGB'S" -- "Nice Guys, But..."  Nice guys, but I'm cheap. Nice guys, but he lives with his mom... Nice guys, but he just out of prison.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Look, he's running after her.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Look, he's in pretty good shape.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Poor Ike.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Ellie asked me to come down to offer moral support.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Since when does Ellie need moral supp--

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: In vino veritas.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Don't knock drunk guys in bars.  Drunk guys in bars are good.  It means they're not driving.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Ike, I really liked the Runaway Bride piece, and since I do freelance stuff for G.Q., I'm in a different position now...

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: What are you trying to say to me, Fish?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Vindication.  How would you like to get some?  A chance to prove that, though your facts weren't entirely straight, your theory was correct.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: The real story on Miss Carpenter.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: All the gory details.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: The anatomy of the black widow spider of Maryland.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: It wouldn't be a bad way to get you back into writing feature pieces again.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: This is good.  It is a good story, Fish.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: If she runs, then it's a cover story. All true.  All accurate.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Okay, you were right.  I hated my column, but I can do this assignment.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Then you've got it.  If you leave tomorrow for the hinterlands, you'll have plenty of time before her next wedding trot.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: "Paid vindication"  That's what I call justice.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Justice, yes.  Paid, I don't know. They like the idea, but my hands are tied with budget restraints.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: But I'll get my normal fee, right?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Don't say "spec" like it's a dirty word. Nobody ever paid Shakespeare to write a play!  Plato never got a book advance...

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Oh yeah!  I happen to know from reliable sources that Nietzche got expenses and a rental car.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Yes, well, my theory was that she may be running because she gets attention... Negative attention is attention. Like when women whack you on the street because of your column, that's negative attention.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: This is about her negative attention, not mine.  Did you get the reimbursement for the dress yet?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: No, I'm paying for the dress.  Do you think she's still gonna run?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Look -- I'll be in there later today. I'll come by and tell you all about it.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: You're coming here?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Then come for dinner.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Okay, we'll order out.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Order out like a Philistine, when you got the Galloping Gourmet here?...

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: No... They're interesting guys.  Each one of these guys has something going for him.  I mean, one's been up Everest. Another's become a priest.  One's a pretty good guitar player.  And this guy today tried to end world hunger, if you can believe that...

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Whoa, Ike.  Getting a complex, buddy?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Of course we are.  Of course.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Then you'll be my best man.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Well, I'm good, I don't know if I'm best.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Go talk to the pastor and he'll tell you what to do.  And someone will tell me what to do.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I have no idea what I'm doing.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Your job is... the ring.  Do you have the ring?!

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I just found out I'm best man!  I'm lucky I have a suit... What's wrong?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Get this man a Kamikaze.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Splendid dissection of Maggie Carpenter, very professional job.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: You could have told me you were fiance number three.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: And end up in the papers?  I've been humiliated enough already to last a lifetime, thank you.  I'm sorry she got you canned.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: She's a cacophony of contradictions.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Well, I'm writing another article on the cacophony.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Ah, can't stay away from her, can you? Like a moth to a flame.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Guess you'd know about that.  You're an entomologist, right?  How's business?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Not bad.  I was traveling around studying the reproductive and migratory patterns of locusts when Maggie met me.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Neuter a locust, feed the world.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Same as you said.  What did you call her?  A "man-eater", "a devouring death goddess."

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I don't think that's why she ran.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Why do YOU think she ran?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I don't know.  I'm working on it.  I was on the wrong track.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: And you defending her?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: No.  I call it like I see it.  I'm a journalist.  I'm a truth teller.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Unbelievable, she got to you.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Oh, please!

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Sorry, no.  I just got one.

turns.speaker: MRS. PRESSMAN
turns.text: Excuse me, sir.  I have an actual fact for you.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Yes, Mrs. Pressman.

turns.speaker: MRS. PRESSMAN
turns.text: It's her fourth time to the altar, you know.  Not seven like they said.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I know.  Tell me something.  Do you think she's going to make it all the way this time?

turns.speaker: MRS. PRESSMAN
turns.text: I'm not sure.  Mr. Schullian runs the newsstand, he's our local bookie, you know, he's giving eight to one odds she won't.  He says she's so famous now, maybe Vegas will give odds on her.  I'm going to wait to hear what the pros say.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Good fact.  Well, you let me know.

turns.speaker: MRS. PRESSMAN
turns.text: Oh, I will.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Well, I'm off.  A reporter's work is never done.  Mrs. Pressman, thank you.

turns.speaker: MRS. PRESSMAN
turns.text: Tootaloo.

turns.speaker: MRS. PRESSMAN
turns.text: It's okay.  There's no microphone. You're no fun.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: No, I'm not.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Hello.  I'm looking for Maggie Carpenter.  There was a sign at the hardware store across the street...

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: Are you a reporter?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: It's been our experience that anyone with some sort of gewgaw on his loafers ends up being another big city reporter wanting to interview Maggie.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: About her upcoming wedding and all.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: No, about her getting that asshole from New York fired.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I am just such a reporter.  And you are?

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: Peggy Phleming.  Not the ice skater.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: And you are?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Looking for Maggie.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: Yep.  Maggie -- Someone to see you.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I think you'd look good in red.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: No, she's talking about your hair.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: Have you listened to his morning show, "Wake up with ballplayer"?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Not yet.  I had a phlemless morning.  I hear he's a pretty good ballplayer.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: This game is pretty important to him. He made all-stars in high school, you know.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: That must have made you proud.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: It's nice that they're still friends.

turns.speaker: PEGGY
turns.text: Oh, sure.  That was a long time ago. See, she's not a man-hater at all. She's very supportive of men...

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Yes, I am.  And who are you?

turns.speaker: MRS. TROUT
turns.text: Betty Trout.  Five dollars.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Oh, Betty.  I take it you're going to be making the wedding cake and they say you're throwing --

turns.speaker: MRS. TROUT
turns.text: -- The luau for Maggie.

turns.speaker: MRS. TROUT
turns.text: Your two cinnamon rolls.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Bye, Betty.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: MRS. TROUT
turns.text: You should thank Lou and I for the wedding car -- a '63 Buick.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MRS. TROUT
turns.text: Oh, come on.  You're practically family.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: They made me put my hat back on.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  Scared the hell out of Skipper.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Gee, I hope they don't have a fight out there.  You don't think they'll call it off...?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well, wedding cake freezes.  This we know.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: You know, your daughter seems...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Like her mother.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Ah, beautiful.  I just can't see her leaving multiple grooms in the dust like that.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Dad's fishing trip, Grandma's knee operation, Grandma's birthday...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Gotta tell you this about my daughter. My daughter makes real good time, even in a long dress and heels.  Maggie may not be Hale's longest running joke, but she certainly is the fastest.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: I hope you have a different angle. It's pretty much all been covered.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Originality is my speciality.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Excellent.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Well, instead of a haircut, how about a wash?  You know, get all that city grit out of it.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: You'll answer my questions?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Getting nervous?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Nervous?  Not at all!  No.  I've never been more certain in my life.  Except -- I am having all kinds of weird dreams.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Weird dreams?  You're going to tell me about them?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I'm not here to make you feel bad.  I'm here for vindication.  In my heart...

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You have one?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Did something happen to make you care about reality?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Yes.  Conviction.  Conviction that I'm onto the truth.  You're going to do the same thing to "poor bastard number four" that you did to the last three.  You're going to run again.  And I'm not leaving until you do.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You're going to be very disappointed.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: We'll see.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: I'd love to stay and chat, but I've got to get back to work.  I still have my job.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: That's fair.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Despite what you think, I don't do it on purpose.  And I have no intention of doing it again.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Everest.  Is that right?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Twice...

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Without oxygen...

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: How romantic.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: We think so.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Nothing like sharing your nuptial bed with two Sherpas and a yak.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Grandma made me the cutest outfit.  I can't wait to show it to you.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: A pre-wedding luau?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Give me that!

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: But the most interesting thing here is that I don't see the rose tattoo that I've heard about on your back.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Look, look, man.  I think the man is heartbroken.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: He is not!

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You've been here for three minutes. What did you do to her?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: You can turn that finger around.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You misinterpret everything.  We've all been friends our whole lives.  But that's the types of relationship you wouldn't understand.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Obviously, I'm not the only one who doesn't understand it.  The USS Maggie leaves quite a wake... Excuse me.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I take it the desk clerk is one of your many admirers.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: How do I do it?  I'm not that beautiful.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You're welcome.  Your notes made interesting bedtime reading -- if you like trashy fiction.  Your observations are distorted, ungrounded an incomplete. You must be very proud.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I'm not a boastful man.  What's your point?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: My point is that one again, you're getting it all wrong.  That won't improve your reputation any, and it's not very flattering to me either.  So, I'm going to give you a chance to write the truth.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: My magazine doesn't pay because for stories.  It's not what you call ethical.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Oh, but making up the facts as you go along is ethical?  Actually, I meant you.  You probably got severance or expenses or both.  I'll take your check. No credit cards.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: You've seen the post-its.  I've already got more juicy material than I need. Why should I pay you dollar one?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Because I think you're writing on spec and with a first person interview, you might actually sell that thing.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Too much.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Seven-fifty.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Five hundred.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Six-fifty.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Done.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: It's a birthday present for my cousin. Put your finger in.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Cindy the manicurist.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I like it.  This whole thing is pretty incredible.  I think you could probably sell this lamp idea in New York.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Maybe someday.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: You afraid to try?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: No, I'm not afraid.  Just... Maybe someday.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Well, I'm impressed.  Absolutely incredible.  I didn't expect pink and lacy, but this isn't exactly a woman's room.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: What an incredible chauvinistic observation.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Always a mood killer.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Still sweet.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: It's a little "Silence of the Lambs" for me.  I can't believe you waited for the wedding to run.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: He's an entomologist!  I thought it was very unique.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: It was one of the most wonderful moments of my life.  Cal Ripken even applauded.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Highly suspect.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: What do you mean?  It was incredibly romantic!

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Maybe it's just me, but -- if you got to dress it up, it doesn't ring true.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I'm a work in progress.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: So?  Is that what you said to her?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: No.  I think I said something eloquent like, "So, uh -- maybe we should, ya know.  What do you think?"

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Now that's romantic.  A proposal like that and you didn't find eternal bliss? What went wrong?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You don't know.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Maybe you should ask her some time. Ever thought of that?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Even with everything that's happened I've still never been married and I still deserve a beautiful dress.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Agreed.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: You look... uh... You look fine.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Fine.  The newspaper's upside down. That's better than fine.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Bob will be very happy.
